name: Spelled the Same Either Way You Look At It! Online Trivia  | 10 Questions

questions.text: This palindrome is a chemical term used to describe the removal of salts from grapes and apples!
questions.explanation:
Detartrated.

	Detannated refers to plant extracts; Deleveled is a term coined for usage in fantasy role playing games which refers to a dropped level; and, Derotored is widely used in palindromic lists but doesn't seem to really mean anything!

questions.text: In the Hebrew alphabet there are five palindromic letters.  Can you pick which of the following they are?
questions.explanation:
Mem, Nun, Waw, Vav, Tet.

	Nun is one, Waw is another but it is also spelt Vav.  Another palindrome is the Hebrew letter name, Teth, is also spelt, Tet, a fifth palindrome letter name!

questions.text: What palindrome is the name of a genus of 'checkered' beetle?
questions.explanation:
Ababa.

	In 1897 this genus of beetles was named, part of the subfamily 'checkered' beetles.  This palindrome is also part of the name of the capital city of Ethiopia, Addis Ababa!

questions.text: What palindrome is one sixtieth of a fluid dram and a musical note?
questions.explanation:
Minim.

	Minim, a noun, is a unit of volume equal to one sixtieth of a fluid dram or one eighth of a fluid ounce and is also a musical note with a time value equal to two crochets or half a semibreve.

questions.text: What was the palindromic name of a 1982 Black Sabbath record album, if you think of Black Sabbath you'd have to think evil!
questions.explanation:
Live Evil.

	Curiously, The Misfits also had a palindromic record album called Evil Live!

questions.text: What palindrome is one of the most common geographical names worldwide?  The original is a village in Scotland!
questions.explanation:
Glenelg & glenelg.

	Glenelg is a popular name - there's a town by this name in the US state of Maryland; a suburb in Adelaide, South Australia; a village in Nova Scotia; a township in Ontario; and, there was a Lord Glenelg who was a British Colonial Secretary.

questions.text: What palindrome is the name of the seed of the Tung Tree?
questions.explanation:
Tung Nut & tung nut.

	Tung Nuts produce Tung Oil or 'China Wood Oil', a natural furniture polish used by the Chinese for centuries to protect and beautify timber.

questions.text: What palindrome is the trademark name for a piece of garden machinery developed in Britain?
questions.explanation:
Rotavator & rotavator.

	The Rotavator, a rotary tiller, is used for controlling weeds, clearing 'stubble' and preparing seed beds on farms and market gardens.

questions.text: Included in Ripley's 'Believe It Or Not', was which American born in 1908 with a palindromic name associated with Christmas?
questions.explanation:
Leon Noel.

	Born on Christmas Eve, Leon Noel spent most of his life in the US state of Florida and he died there on Christmas Day 1999!

questions.text: In what country is the palindromic Halalah a unit of currency?
questions.explanation:
Saudi Arabia.

	The Saudi Riyal equals one hundred Halalah.
